description.full: This is the base class for the GLFW renderer that you can optionally use with openFrameworks. We've moved away from GLUT and towards GLFW for our windowing system. You probably won't deal with this a great deal (hopefully).

methods.name: char_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, uint32_t key

methods.name: drop_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, int numFiles, const char **dropString
methods.desc: This is the drag and drop callback. This should be handled in your ofBaseApp instance.

methods.name: entry_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, int entered

methods.name: error_cb
methods.parameters: int errorCode, const char *errorDescription

methods.name: exit_cb
methods.desc: This is the exit callback that is called by your the ofAppRunner exit() method.

methods.name: framebuffer_size_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, int w, int h

methods.name: getHeight
methods.desc: Gets the height of the current window and is mirrored in the ofGetScreenHeight() method.

methods.name: getScreenSize
methods.desc: Gets the height of the current window and is mirrored in the ofGetWindowSize() method.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.desc: Gets the height of the current window and is mirrored in the ofGetScreenWidth() method.

methods.name: getWindowMode
methods.desc: Returns one of the following: OF_FULLSCREEN or OF_WINDOW.

methods.name: getWindowPosition
methods.desc: This returns the location of the window relative to the deivce that it's being displayed on.

methods.name: keyboard_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, int key, int scancode, int action, int mods

methods.name: motion_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, double x, double y

methods.name: mouse_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, int button, int state, int mods

methods.name: resize_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, int w, int h

methods.name: scroll_cb
methods.parameters: GLFWwindow *windowP_, double x, double y

methods.name: setWindowPosition
methods.parameters: int x, int y

methods.name: setWindowShape
methods.parameters: int w, int h

methods.name: pixelScreenCoordScale
methods.short: Extents of the window client area, which may be scaled by pixelsScreenCoordScale to map to physical framebuffer pixels.

methods.name: windowRect
methods.short: Scale factor from virtual operating-system defined client area extents (as seen in currentW, currentH) to physical framebuffer pixel coordinates (as seen in windowW, windowH).

page.document:
#class ofAppGLFWWindow

##InlineDescription

##Description

This is the base class for the GLFW renderer that you can optionally use with openFrameworks. We've moved away from GLUT and towards GLFW for our windowing system. You probably won't deal with this a great deal (hopefully).

page.raw:
#class ofAppGLFWWindow


<!--
_visible: True_
_advanced: False_
_istemplated: False_
_extends: ofAppBaseGLWindow_
-->

##InlineDescription






##Description

This is the base class for the [GLFW](https://github.com/glfw) renderer that you can optionally use with openFrameworks. We've moved away from GLUT and towards GLFW for our windowing system. You probably won't deal with this a great deal (hopefully).





##Methods
